ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates a chart with three line-series and a Logarithmic X-Axis and Y-Axis
ExampleDefinition.Description:
This example demonstrates X,Y or Z [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Axis.LogarithmicNumericAxis3D.html']Logarithmic Axis[/url] axis in SciChart 3D. Click the controls to change state.
[b][i]Example Usage[/i][/b]
- Drag to zoom - Double click to zoom to extents - Change the Logarithmic Base from Log10, to LogE to Log2
[b][i]Tips![/i][/b]
The axis labels may be formatted using Scientific notation with Superscript. See the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Axis.LogarithmicNumericAxis3D~ScientificNotation.html']LogarithmicNumericAxis3D.ScientificNotation[/url] property in the help file.
[b]Documentation Links[/b]
- [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Axis.LogarithmicNumericAxis3D.html']LogarithmicNumericAxis3D Type[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#Creating%20your%20first%20SciChart3DSurface.html']SciChart3DSurface Type[/url]
